column3: ## Test Admin Application Search Display
Go to the DOAJ admin application search at /admin/applications
Open the "Application Status" facet and select "Rejected"

column4: Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

column3: Click on "View finished application" for one of the results

column4: You are taken to the edit form for the application
The Quick Reject feature is not available

column3: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Rejected" filter and select "Accepted" from the "Application Status" facet

column4: Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

column3: Clear the "Accepted" filter and select any other status except "Rejected" from the "Application Status" facet

column4: Every result includes the text "Review application" or "Review update" on the bottom right

column3: Click on "Review Application"

column4: You are taken to the edit form for the application in a new tab
The Quick Reject feature is available

column3: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Application Status" filter
Open the "Record type" facet and select "new application"

column4: Every result includes the text "Review application" on the bottom right

column3: Clear the "new application" filter and select "update request" from the "Record type" facet

column4: Every result includes the text "View journal being updated" and "Review update" at the bottom
The metadata for each record contains the field "Update Request For", and then an alphanumeric ID of a journal

column3: Click on the alphanumeric journal id

column4: You are taken to the admin Journal search interface, and there is one result, which is the current journal for that update request

column3: Click back (as many times as needed) in your browser to return to the application search
Click on "view journal being updated" on the bottom right of one of your search results

column4: You are taken to the Journal Form of the journal being updated

column3: Click "Unlock and Close"
Click on "Review update"

column4: The update request review form is shown

column3: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Record type" filter
Open the "Journal License" facet and select one of the CC licences

column4: The "Journal Licence" metadata field in each search result has the appropriate CC icon displayed
